item.title: hololive Holo’s Hanafuda adds PS5, PS4, and Switch versions, launches July 31
item.content:encoded:
https://www.gematsu.com/2025/03/hololive-holos-hanafuda-adds-ps5-ps4-and-switch-versions-launches-july-31

  • PC
  • PS4
  • PS5
  • Switch

Physical edition available for Switch in Japan.

hololive Holo’s Hanafuda will launch digitally worldwide for PlayStation 5, PlayStation 4, and Switch alongside its previously announced PC (Steam) version on July 31 for 3,850 yen, developer Gemdrops announced.

In Japan, a physical edition will also be available for Switch. It will cost 5,280 yen for the standard edition and 16,500 yen for the limited edition. The latter includes a special box, a copy of the game, a Nintendo special hanafuda card set, an original furoshiki, a mini folding screen, a soundtrack CD, a hanafuda art book, and a set of bento stickers.

Here is an overview of the game, via its Steam page:

About

hololive Holo’s Hanafuda is a modern take on the classic Japanese card game, hanafuda. In hololive Holo’s Hanafuda, you can battle it out with cards that feature original hololive member art!

In addition to hanafuda’s traditional rule systems—Koi-Koi, Oicho-Kabu, and Hana Awase—this game also features an original gameplay mode called “Holo Awase.” That makes for a total of four different playable rule sets with which you can battle your opponents both online and offline!

Holo Awase

Match cards with hololive characters on them to finish holo sets and unleash each character’s powerful unique skill! Get the most sets and the most points to beat your opponent!

Multiple Modes?!

Though matches form the bulk of this game, there is more than just hanafuda to this game! Adventure Mode, for instance, takes players on a wild story-based adventure with their hololive friends—with a healthy dose of hanafuda to boot, of course. Then there’s the cozy bento box mode, where you can make bento lunch boxes alongside hololive characters, too. All this and more awaits you in hololive Holo’s Hanafuda!

Watch a new trailer below.

Release Date Trailer

item.title: FUBUKI ~zero in on Holoearth~ HOLOLIVE ALTERNATIVE launches April 13
item.content:encoded:
https://www.gematsu.com/2025/03/fubuki-zero-in-on-holoearth-hololive-alternative-launches-april-13

  • PC

Pixel art high-speed action game dated.

Pixel art high-speed action game FUBUKI ~zero in on Holoearth~ HOLOLIVE ALTERNATIVE will launch for PC via Steam on April 13, publisher Phoenixx and developer PEPOSOFT announced. It will support English, Japanese, Traditional Chinese, and Simplified Chinese language options. A demo is currently available.

Here is an overview of the game, via its Steam page:

About

FUBUKI ~zero in on Holoearth~ HOLOLIVE ALTERNATIVE is a high-speed pixel action game where you control the protagonist, Shirakami Fubuki, and battle using swords and skills.

An Exhilarating 2D Pixel Action Adventure With Fubuki Across Holoearth!

You take control of Shirakami Fubuki, one of the Kami residing in Yamato.

With her beloved sword Murasamemaru, she skillfully performs sword fights, high-speed movement, and even wall jumps with ease.

Fight alongside Fubuki, defeat the “Ayakashi” blocking your path, and resolve the anomalies occurring in Holoearth.

(This game is developed with reference to the world settings of the teaser PV and manga of Hololive Alternative. Please note that some content and expressions may differ from the official settings.)

The world of Holoearth is diverse and ever-changing.

Each stage features a completely different appearance, enemies, and mechanics.

Utilize your player skills and the allies you meet along the way to overcome challenging obstacles.

During your adventure, you may encounter Hololive members who have been corrupted by Kegare and turned hostile.

Defeat them to restore their sanity—they will surely lend you their strength once they are back to normal.

If you missed it in February, watch the announcement trailer here.
